alert.note: Alert for Louisa (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 5:50PM EDT until August 10 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties, Goochland, Hanover and Louisa. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 550 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen so far this evening. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area during the next 45 minutes. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goochland, Hadensville, Gum Spring, Bumpass, Locust Creek, Orchid, Apple Grove, Dabneys, Mabelton, Vontay, Sandy Hook, Cuckoo, Fredericks Hall, Othma, Irwin, Beaverdam, Three Square and West View. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
